39572867.review: This game is absolutely ridiculous. I haven't written a review for a game before; nor have I finished this game yet, but I'm going to guess that I'm around halfway through, and that I've played enough to tell you what to expect. The beginning is super slow and really hard to keep going with, but once you get to what I'm guessing is the main point of the plot, everything just gets ridiculous. The fantasy world's equivalent of the Pope plays trading card games. The boss your party just defeated in a raid is now giving you betting advice for a coliseum fight between animals, cause apparently it's just his job to be the boss when he's on shift or something. WELCOME. The beginning part actually seems like your decisions are important. Where I'm at now, not only has that sense of importance faded, but I can't even begin to expect what kind of ridiculous event I'll get for picking a particular choice. It's a really good laugh. Like, a REALLY good laugh. All you have to do is get past the beginning; that's when you'll likely start enjoying it, just for the sheer incredulity.

39562513.review:
So- this game is not what I expected. I really enjoyed this game, but I will go with the Pro/Con format:

[H1]PROs:[/H1]
[list]
 [*] The story is actually pretty good. There's some logic jumps, but it starts out rather humorous.
 [*] Art is not what I'd call fantastic, but it is definitely good.
 [*] The 'Auto' mode is actually pretty dynamic based on the amount of text on screen.
 [*] Beautiful and varied backgrounds.
 [*] You can really empathize with some characters throughout the story.
 [*] The 'Skip' mechanic is very nice.
[/list]
[H1]CONs:[/H1]
[list]
 [*] This is definitely more story than it is an interactive story. There's a ton of points where you'll be the focus of the conversation, easily opening it up for player response, but it never comes. I can't tell if it was laziness or just poor decision making on the part of the developer.
 [*] While the art is good, there's some gripes. Other character proportions are not consistent throughout. Some of the scenes resolution seem to vary, which is jarring.
 [*] Severe lack of "outcome images". There's a few reasons I play games like this, but one of which is the choice resolution outcome imagery. There's only like 2 and half pages here. Very limited.
 [*] Very rare, but there are times where what the text says does not match up with the character's expression on-screen.
 [*] No 'harem' ending.
 [*] Lacks in what I would call 'lewd' imagery.
[/list]

After playing this game with all endings and images, I immediately checked this developer's Steam page for more of this game type- but found there was none. Sad.

39543947.review:
I really like this VN and its parody on the oversaturated isekai genre (i.e. MC gets transported to another world to save it) with some hilarious RPG tropes that make it stand out from the crowd.

Pros:
+great characters
+beautiful art
+appealing soundtrack
+good story
+very easy to read (no overwhelming lore and terminology that some other VNs have, like fault milestone)
+decent number of choices that can affect who you end up with
+all 3 girls are super likeable (I'm partial to chise)

Cons:
-some parts of the story feel a bit rushed (pacing issues)
-because of this, the game feels a bit short, even if you get all achievements (i finished it in around 5 and a half hours)

No saucy hentai here, but there's an uncensor patch that uncensors certain CGs that would definitely make the game NSFW (eg. the obligatory hot springs scene). Again, no hentai stuff, but honestly this game is great without it.

Would I recommend it? Hell yes. For $10? Maybe, but definitely get it on sale if you can.

39521582.review:
This is my first time writing a review for a visual novel.

This story gave me vibes from mostly KonoSuba(The anime) with romance added to the formula. An Isekai visual novel which is definitely cliche, but manages to do very well for the genre. I will only recommend you playing this blind as you have the ability to choose between the three heroines or none of them. Not only that, there are multiple endings for this in which it is based on the choices you make throughout the progression. It also has fanservice in the formula which is amusing as always.

Story 9/10: I am basically drawn to anything with romance involved. It's usually the good endings that I'm more drawn to than the bittersweet ones.
Art 8.5/10: I actually expected less of the art but this surprised me.
Characters 10/10: I love all the characters since I can easily grow to like anyone at all.
Enjoyment 9/10: The story pacing isn't too rushed and you suddenly get to experience chemistry between these characters actually working somehow like KonoSuba's did.
Overall 9/10: One of my most anticipated Isekai visual novels have lived up to the hype I had and it was totally worth it.

39488941.review:
This is a fun story about a boy who wakes up in another world where RPG concepts are part of the real world.  The town he wakes up in is being attacked by monsters, so he tries to help defend the town and solve the mystery of why it is constantly being attacked.

He meets a number of adventurers on the quest to solve the mystery.  They have their own motives for wanting to help and it is interesting to see their back stories.  There is some character development, but it is not much since it is a fairly short story.  It took me about nine hours to read one route, but I read slowly to take in the details.

It is fun to see RPG concepts applied to the real world.  I thought it was done in clever and interesting ways.  It made me want to find out more about the world they are in and to follow the characters to see what they would uncover next.  It is a well-written story and I enjoyed the characters and the world that they lived in.

I would recommend this this to any RPG fan.  For NPCs (non-RPG fans ;-), you will enjoy the story and have fun, but will probably not appreciate some of the RPG-specific humor.

39485265.review:
I played this game briefly (due to a lack of time AUGH!) and my impressions of this game is EXCELLENT.  The character designs are A.  The script is B (depending on whether you like the jokes) with few grammatical errors; the script is clearly written by a native English speaker rather than an overseas product with poor Google translation (: .  I paid 8 bucks for the game and it's not a bad price for the product.  The options (A+) include changing between windowed and full screen, adjustment for sound volume, and text speed plus skipping.  The game can be saved an any point (YAY!).  There is a quick save and a quick load function.  Game devs also provide plenty of slots for normal saves, too.  Probably the best feature is the CG gallery.  The patch is available from the publisher's website at no cost and works.

Overall, Ascendant Hearts is a very polished game and highly recommended to visual novel fans.

В остальном, это 9 (девять) часов вдумчивого чтения на тему штампов ониму вкупе с jrpg и попавшего в него(них) отаку. Или 4 (четыре) часа чтения по диагонали со скоростным жмаканием пробела. “Исекай визуаль новель”, как бусурмане говорят.
Картинки среднего качества, задников мало. Персонажи отрисованы так же средне, анимация… нууууу...она как бы есть… технически.
История лучше. Местами очень смешно. Хиханьки над штампами удались. Персонажи выпуклые. Четыре девицы (четыре концовки) с прописанными линиями. Жаль, что все довольно линейно, но тем не менее, я наслаждался диалогами.
Довольно хорошая вещь за 200 рублей. Прекрасно подойдет для чтения в дороге в скоростном поезде, или ожидания в аэропорту, или для чтения жарким летним днем в тени яблони, или для 200-300 посещений туалетной кабинки.

39470603.review:
This is a decent if short "transported to another world" / isekai visual novel.

The characters are all very likable and you're given a fair amount of choice throughout the game. The choices you make do make impact throughout the game which is very nice. For example, you can't just snub off everyone then confess to them expecting them to suddenly fall for you in return. Great change of pace.

The game is arounnd ~4 hours if you go for all the achievements. I got this when it was discounted for $8 which is a good pricing for a VN with decent branching to this extent. No ground breaking story break offs but still nice.

The art is pleasing to the eye and though the cg count isn't too high, what's there is nice.

The only real low points are the climax and the ending. After humorously poking at cliches for a majority of the story, it quickly ends on a big cliche that just doesn't feel satisfying. 

On that point however, the story throughout and character dialogue was extremely enjoyable. Though its impact will mainly be for those that are at least aware of standard RPG tropes.

Overall, an enjoyable read that I found worth and got a smile out of.
